Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Pac-525 (P9-0; Trp-rich; Arg-rich; XXE; XXA, UCLL1c; synthetic AMPs20)

Literature Information.Literature: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of this peptide most resembles (44% similarity)Combi-1.Activity: The recombinat form is more active against E. coli (MIC 2 uM) and S. aureus (MIC 4 uM).Antimicrobial robustness:  NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:E. coli (5 mM salt); NaCl-sensitive:P. aeruginosa (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-sensitive:P. aeruginosa (5 mM salt); NaCl-insensitive:S. auerus (100-200 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:S. auerus (5 mM salt); NaCl-sensitive:C. albicans (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:C. albicans (5 mM salt); NaCl-insensitive:F. solani (100-300 mM salt); MgCl2-insensitive:F. solani (5 mM salt).   Updated 7/2021; 10/2021; Jan2023; 7/2023
Literature Information.Author: Wei SY, Wu JM, Kuo YY, Chen HL, Yip BS, Tzeng SR, Cheng JW.
Literature Information.Title: Solution structure of a novel tryptophan-rich peptide with bidirectional antimicrobial activity
